snippet: The killing of Chokri Belaid, a harsh critic of the ruling Islamist-led party, has led to fears that polarization and growing political violence will imperil Tunisia’s transition.
abstract: Tens of thousands of people turn out for funeral of Tunisia's assassinated opposition leader Chokri Belaid, show of anger at country's Islamist-led government; killing of Belaid, harsh critic of ruling government, has raised fears that polarization and political violence will imperil Tunisia's transition.

byline.contributor: Aida Alami and Farah Samti contributed reporting from Tunis, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The killing of Chokri Belaid, a harsh critic of the ruling Islamist-led party, has led to fears that polarization and growing political violence will imperil Tunisia’s transition.

headline.seo: Amid Uncertainty, Tunisians Bury Slain Opposition Leader
headline.main: Tunisians’ Anger on Display at Funeral
headline.print_headline: Tunisians’ Anger on Display at Funeral

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
